isis.stitle: Recall 99304 - Tire Pressure Error on Certification Label

recall.subject: Tire Pressure Error on Certification Label

defect.para: American Transportation has mailed to the affected customers the following notice. This notice is sent to you in accordance with the requirements of the National Traffic and Motor Vehicle Safety Act. American Transportation Corporation has determined that the certification label in certain AmTran RE™ and AmTran FE™ buses fail to conform to federal regulation requirements for tire pressure.
On some of the above AmTran RE™ and AmTran FE™ buses the air pressure specified, on the certification label, for the front axle and/or rear axle is in error.
The affected AmTran FE™ and AmTran RE™ model buses were built from February 15, 1994 through January 27, 1999.

ownernote.para: The customer has been sent a recall letter asking them to complete and return the " AUTHORIZATION FOR RECALL SERVICE" card that was enclosed with their notice. When the card is returned to us with box number 8 checked, we will forward, to their attention, a new certification label that will have the correct tire pressures stated. We also requested that the customer refer to the driver's manual for proper tire pressure.

svcprocinfo.para: The certification label is located on the forward overhead panel above the driver.

figure.caption: Metal Certification Label Located Above Driver

svcsubproc.title: Paper Certification Label
svcsubproc.para: To repair, remove the backing off of the new label and apply it directly over the existing certification label.

svcsubproc.title: Metal Certification Labels
svcsubproc.para: To repair, remove the rivets using a # 27 bit, drill through the center of all four rivets that retain the metal tag to the bulkhead panel. Remove and destroy the old metal tag. Install the new enclosed metal tag in the same location using four rivets (part #400050000) enclosed.

entry.para: Remove and install new Metal Certification (when required)
Locate vehicle and complete recall information

responuscan.para:
Proceed immediately to make necessary correction to units in inventory. All inventory vehicles subject to this recall campaign must be corrected prior to sale, transfer or delivery.
If vehicles have been sold or transferred and you are in receipt of Customer Notification Letters and Authorization for Recall Service cards for those vehicles, transfer location or customer must be notified IMMEDIATELY from your dealer location.

The National Traffic and Motor Vehicle Safety Act, as amended, provides that each vehicle that is subject to a vehicle recall campaign must be adequately repaired within a reasonable time after the owner has tendered it for repair. A failure to adequately repair within 60 days after a tender of a vehicle is prima facie evidence of failure to repair within a reasonable time. If the condition is not adequately repaired within 60 days, the owner may be entitled to replacement with an identical or reasonable equivalent vehicle at no charge, or to a refund of the purchase price less a reasonable allowance for depreciation.

In order to avoid having to replace an owner vehicle or refund the purchase price, every effort must be made to promptly schedule an appointment with each owner to repair his or her vehicle as soon as possible.
